As with many of the higher capacity flash drives, this is pretty slow to write.  I created a 2.4Gig zip of a bunch of mp3 files and wrote to this drive today using a Windows 7 Pro machine.  Took over 9 minutes for about 4.5MB/sec.  Then wrote that same file back to the hard drive and took just over 2 minutes for about 20MB/sec.  Has nothing to do with USB2 or USB3.  That's the drive's speed.

The picture shows a chip density of 16 chips.  The actual density is 8 chips.  That's an important distinction in an HP laptop.
